channel.title: CyberNetSec - Cyberattack
channel.description: Latest cyberattack threat intelligence - the last 10 articles

item.title: China-Linked Hackers Exploit Critical Cisco Email Gateway Zero-Day
item.description:
Cisco has revealed that a China-affiliated advanced persistent threat (APT) group, tracked as UAT-9686, is actively exploiting a critical zero-day vulnerability in its email security products. The flaw, CVE-2025-20393, is a remote code execution vulnerability with a maximum CVSS score of 10.0, affec...

Severity: Critical

Categories: Vulnerability, Threat Actor, Cyberattack

Read Full Article →

item.title: Actively Exploited RCE Flaw in WatchGuard Firewalls Puts Networks at Risk
item.description:
WatchGuard has issued an urgent advisory for customers to patch CVE-2025-14733, a critical remote code execution vulnerability in its Fireware OS that is confirmed to be under active exploitation. The flaw, an out-of-bounds write issue in the IKEv2 process, has a CVSS score of 9.3 and can be exploit...

Severity: Critical

Categories: Vulnerability, Cyberattack, Patch Management

Read Full Article →

item.title: Manufacturing Web Portals Are a Weak Link in Supply Chain Attacks
item.description:
A new report reveals that cybercriminals are increasingly targeting manufacturers through their public-facing web portals, such as supplier and customer forms, to execute supply chain attacks. Attackers are using bots and SQL injection to compromise these forms, which often run on legacy systems wit...

Severity: High

Categories: Supply Chain Attack, Cyberattack, Data Breach

Read Full Article →

item.title: "GhostPoster" Malware Infects 50,000+ Firefox Users via Malicious Add-ons
item.description:
A stealthy malware campaign named "GhostPoster" has infected over 50,000 Mozilla Firefox users by distributing 17 malicious browser extensions. The add-ons, which masqueraded as legitimate tools like VPNs and ad blockers, have been removed from the Firefox store. The malware employed a clever techni...

Severity: Medium

Categories: Malware, Cyberattack

Read Full Article →

item.title: "Scripted Sparrow" BEC Group Targets Finance Teams with Highly Structured Attacks
item.description:
A disciplined and persistent Business Email Compromise (BEC) group, newly identified by Fortra as "Scripted Sparrow," has been systematically targeting corporate finance teams since at least June 2024. The group employs a structured and well-researched approach, sending highly credible phishing emai...

Severity: High

Categories: Threat Actor, Phishing, Cyberattack

Read Full Article →

item.title: "IRLeaks" Supply Chain Attack Hits Iranian Banks, Exposing Millions of Customer Records
item.description:
A major supply chain attack dubbed "IRLeaks" has resulted in a significant data breach affecting several prominent Iranian banks and millions of their customers. Attackers first compromised a third-party IT vendor in October 2025, using it as a pivot point to infiltrate the banks' networks. Over the...

Severity: High

Categories: Data Breach, Supply Chain Attack, Cyberattack

Read Full Article →

item.title: "Operation ForumTroll" APT Targets Russian Academics with Plagiarism Lure
item.description:
The Advanced Persistent Threat (APT) group known as Operation ForumTroll has launched a new, highly targeted phishing campaign aimed at Russian political scientists and academics. Active since at least 2022, the group's latest attack uses meticulously crafted emails impersonating a major Russian sci...

Severity: High

Categories: Threat Actor, Phishing, Cyberattack

Read Full Article →

item.title: Google Investigates Malicious Code Found in Search Result Infrastructure
item.description:
Google has launched an urgent investigation after cybersecurity analysts discovered anomalous, encrypted code snippets and obfuscated JavaScript embedded within its core search result payloads on December 17, 2025. The malicious code appears designed to exploit browser sandboxing vulnerabilities, wh...

Severity: Critical

Categories: Cyberattack, Data Breach, Security Operations

Read Full Article →

item.title: French Interior Ministry Confirms Cyberattack Compromised Email Servers
item.description:
The French Ministry of the Interior has confirmed its email servers were compromised in a cyberattack detected between December 11 and 12, 2025. Interior Minister Laurent Nuñez stated that attackers stole staff email passwords, allowing them to access an unknown number of document files. While the g...

Severity: High

Categories: Data Breach, Cyberattack, Threat Actor

Read Full Article →

item.title: Active Attacks Exploit Critical Fortinet SSO Bypass Flaws to Gain Admin Access
item.description:
Security firm Arctic Wolf has observed active exploitation of two critical authentication bypass vulnerabilities in Fortinet products, CVE-2025-59718 and CVE-2025-59719. Both flaws, rated 9.1 in severity, allow an unauthenticated attacker to bypass FortiCloud single sign-on (SSO) by forging a SAML m...

Severity: Critical

Categories: Vulnerability, Cyberattack, Patch Management

Read Full Article →
